snippet: A Lake County judge has ruled that Indiana’s right-to-work law violates a part of the state Constitution barring the delivery of services “without just compensation.”
abstract: Indiana Judge John Sedia rules that state's right-to-work law violates part of state Constitution barring delivery of services 'without just compensation'; finds that law wrongly requires unions to represent worker who do not pay dues.
lead_paragraph: A Lake County judge has ruled that Indiana’s right-to-work law violates a part of the state Constitution barring the delivery of services “without just compensation.”
